    • nonStart

      public String nonStart(String a, String b)
      Given 2 strings, returns their concatenation, excluding the first character of each. The strings will be at least length 1.
      Parameters:
      a - The first input string.
      b - The second input string.
      Returns:
      The concatenation of the input strings with the first character of each omitted.

    • left2

      public String left2(String str)
      Given a string, returns a "rotated left 2" version where the first 2 characters are moved to the end. The string length will be at least 2.
      Parameters:
      str - The input string.
      Returns:
      The string with the first 2 characters moved to the end.

    • right2

      public String right2(String str)
      Given a string, returns a "rotated right 2" version where the last 2 characters are moved to the start. The string length will be at least 2.
      Parameters:
      str - The input string.
      Returns:
      The string with the last 2 characters moved to the start.

    • middleThree

      public String middleThree(String str)
      Given a string of odd length, returns the substring of length 3 from its middle.
      Parameters:
      str - The input string.
      Returns:
      The substring of length 3 from the middle of the input string.

    • lastTwo

      public String lastTwo(String str)
      Given a string of any length, returns a new string where the last 2 characters, if present, are swapped.
      Parameters:
      str - The input string.
      Returns:
      The input string with the last two characters swapped, or the original string if its length is less than 2.

    • seeColor

      public String seeColor(String str)
      Given a string, returns "red" if the string begins with "red", "blue" if the string begins with "blue", otherwise returns an empty string.
      Parameters:
      str - The input string.
      Returns:
      Either "red", "blue", or an empty string based on the beginning of the input string.

    • theEnd

      public String theEnd(String str, boolean front)
      Given a string, returns a string of length 1 from its front if 'front' is true, otherwise returns a string of length 1 from its back. The string will be non-empty.
      Parameters:
      str - The input string.
      front - Indicates whether to return the character from the front (true) or the back (false).
      Returns:
      A string of length 1 from the specified end of the input string.
